parts.text: Which of the following energy resources is non-renewable?
markScheme: Answer: C – Coal is a finite fossil fuel

parts.text: Explain why fossil fuels are described as non-renewable energy resources.
markScheme: 1 mark: Fossil fuels take **millions of years** to form
1 mark: They are used **much faster** than they are replaced
1 mark: Once used they will eventually **run out**

questions.title: Advantages and disadvantages of wind power

parts.text: Which two statements are advantages of wind power?
options: Output is reliable at all times
markScheme: 1 mark: No greenhouse gases during operation

parts.text: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of using wind turbines to generate electricity.
markScheme: 1 mark: Wind is a **renewable** energy resource
1 mark: Produces **no greenhouse gases** during operation
1 mark: Electricity generation is **unreliable** due to variable wind speeds
1 mark: Visual impact, **noise pollution**, or environmental impact

parts.text: A country wants to reduce its carbon dioxide emissions while maintaining a reliable electricity supply. Evaluate the use of nuclear power as part of its energy mix.
markScheme: 1 mark: Nuclear power produces **very low carbon dioxide** emissions during operation
1 mark: Nuclear power can provide a **reliable base load** of electricity
1 mark: Uses **finite fuel** so is non-renewable
1 mark: Produces **radioactive waste** requiring long-term storage
1 mark: Risk of **serious accidents** (e.g. reactor failure)
1 mark: Reasoned conclusion weighing advantages and disadvantages
